Source code for ProbPy.tests.factor_mult_tests

from nose.tools import with_setup, nottest

from ProbPy.tests.factor_base import FactorBase



[docs]class TestFactorMult(FactorBase):

[docs]    def mult_test_0(self):
        """
        f(X), scalar
        """

        res = [0]*3
        res[0] = self.X_factor.mult(self.scalar)
        res[1] = self.X_factor.mult(self.scalarf)
        res[2] = self.scalarf.mult(self.X_factor)

        for i in range(3):
            assert(res[i].rand_vars == [self.X] and
                   res[i].values == [10, 20])



[docs]    def mult_test_1(self):
        """
        f(X, Y), scalar
        """

        res = [0]*3
        res[0] = self.XY_factor.mult(self.scalar)
        res[1] = self.XY_factor.mult(self.scalarf)
        res[2] = self.scalarf.mult(self.XY_factor)

        for i in range(3):
            assert(res[i].rand_vars == [self.X, self.Y] and
                   res[i].values == [10, 20, 30, 40])



[docs]    def mult_test_2(self):
        """
        f(X, Y, Z), scalar
        """

        res = [0]*3
        res[0] = self.XYZ_factor.mult(self.scalar)
        res[1] = self.XYZ_factor.mult(self.scalarf)
        res[2] = self.scalarf.mult(self.XYZ_factor)

        for i in range(3):
            assert(res[i].rand_vars == [self.X, self.Y, self.Z] and
                   res[i].values == [10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80])



[docs]    def mult_test_3(self):
        """
        f(X), f(X)
        """

        res = self.X_factor.mult(self.X_factor)
        assert(res.rand_vars == [self.X] and
               res.values == [1, 4])



[docs]    def mult_test_4(self):
        """
        f(X), f(Y)
        """

        res = self.X_factor.mult(self.Y_factor)
        assert(res.rand_vars == [self.X, self.Y] and
               res.values == [3, 6, 4, 8])



[docs]    def mult_test_5(self):
        """
        f(X, Y) f(X)
        """

        res = self.XY_factor.mult(self.X_factor)
        assert(res.rand_vars == [self.X, self.Y] and
               res.values == [1, 4, 3, 8])



[docs]    def mult_test_6(self):
        """
        f(X, Y) f(Y)
        """

        res = self.XY_factor.mult(self.Y_factor)
        assert(res.rand_vars == [self.X, self.Y] and
               res.values == [3, 6, 12, 16])



[docs]    def mult_test_7(self):
        """
        f(X, Y) f(Z)
        """

        res = self.XY_factor.mult(self.Z_factor)
        assert(res.rand_vars == [self.X, self.Y, self.Z] and
               res.values == [
                   5, 10, 15, 20,
                   6, 12, 18, 24])



[docs]    def mult_test_8(self):
        """
        f(X, Y) f(X, Y)
        """

        res = self.XY_factor.mult(self.XY_factor)
        assert(res.rand_vars == [self.X, self.Y] and
               res.values == [1, 4, 9, 16])



[docs]    def mult_test_9(self):
        """
        f(X, Y) F(X, Z)
        """

        res = self.XY_factor.mult(self.XZ_factor)
        assert(res.rand_vars == [self.X, self.Y, self.Z] and
               res.values == [
                   5, 12, 15, 24,
                   7, 16, 21, 32])



[docs]    def mult_test_10(self):
        """
        f(X, Y) f(Z, W)
        """

        res = self.XY_factor.mult(self.ZW_factor)
        assert(res.rand_vars == [self.X, self.Y, self.Z, self.W] and
               res.values == [
                   9, 18, 27, 36,
                   10, 20, 30, 40,
                   11, 22, 33, 44,
                   12, 24, 36, 48])



[docs]    def mult_test_11(self):
        """
        f(X, Y, Z) f(X, Y, Z)
        """

        res = self.XYZ_factor.mult(self.XYZ_factor)
        assert(res.rand_vars == [self.X, self.Y, self.Z] and
               res.values == [
                   1, 4, 9, 16,
                   25, 36, 49, 64])



[docs]    def mult_test_12(self):
        """
        f(X, Y, Z) f(X, Y, W)
        """

        res = self.XYZ_factor.mult(self.XYW_factor)
        assert(res.rand_vars == [self.X, self.Y, self.Z, self.W] and
               res.values == [
                   9, 20, 33, 48,
                   45, 60, 77, 96,
                   13, 28, 45, 64,
                   65, 84, 105, 128])



[docs]    def mult_test_13(self):
        """
        f(X, Y, Z) f(X, K, W)
        """

        res = self.XYZ_factor.mult(self.XKW_factor)
        assert(res.rand_vars == [self.X, self.Y, self.Z, self.K, self.W] and
               res.values == [
                   17, 36, 51, 72,
                   85, 108, 119, 144,
                   19, 40, 57, 80,
                   95, 120, 133, 160,

                   21, 44, 63, 88,
                   105, 132, 147, 176,
                   23, 48, 69, 96,
                   115, 144, 161, 192])



[docs]    def mult_test_14(self):
        """
        f(X, Y, Z) f(T, K, W)
        """

        res = self.XYZ_factor.mult(self.TKW_factor)
        assert(res.rand_vars == [
            self.X, self.Y, self.Z,
            self.T, self.K, self.W] and
            res.values == [
                25, 50, 75, 100,
                125, 150, 175, 200,
                26, 52, 78, 104,
                130, 156, 182, 208,

                27, 54, 81, 108,
                135, 162, 189, 216,
                28, 56, 84, 112,
                140, 168, 196, 224,

                29, 58, 87, 116,
                145, 174, 203, 232,
                30, 60, 90, 120,
                150, 180, 210, 240,

                31, 62, 93, 124,
                155, 186, 217, 248,
                32, 64, 96, 128,
                160, 192, 224, 256])
